ISSUE.TITLE: create-nocodb-app fail when used from a path containing a space
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : 0.81.1 Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 OS on which NocoDB is running : macos 12.0.1 Node.js version if running as node : v14.17.1 Database version : NA **Steps To Reproduce** 1. `cd` to folder with spaces in the path (ie: `/Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories`) 2. Run `npx create-nocodb-app` 3. Answer questions (sqlite3, as Node.js Project) And here it is: ``` Now, executing command : cd /Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories/impressed_ferret /bin/sh: line 0: cd: /Users/flavien/Developer/My: No such file or directory Error running command internally "cd /Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories/impressed_ferret" Exiting... ``` **Expected behavior** Take spaces in path into account, and don't throw error. **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46444098/140413033-a1720e15-ab88-400f-83dd-14d1e013ecf7.png) Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help. Node version : **v14.17.1** Arch type: **x64** Platform: **macos** Docker: **false** Database: **sqlite3** packageVersion: **0.81.1**
